arm_group.description: Group 1 will have standard peroneal repair surgery with the addition of the NEOX™1k tissue.
Group 2 will have standard peroneal repair surgery without the use of the NEOX™1k tissue.

brief_summary.textblock:
Peroneal tendon tears are a common etiology encountered by foot and ankle surgeons.  Like
      all flexor tendon repairs adhesions are one of the more common challenges after surgery.
      Peroneal tendon gliding is key to their function as effective plantar flexors and evertors
      of the hindfoot.  Scarring and adhesion correlate directly with the amount of inflammatory
      reaction at the wound site (Adzick 1994).  Our goal is to have a surgical technique that
      allows for standard suture repair of the tendon yet allows for smooth gliding of the tendon
      with minimal adhesions. A prospective review on the surgical repair of the peroneal tendons
      utilizing NEOX™1k (Amniox Medical, Marietta, GA), cryopreserved Human Amniotic Membrane
      (C-HAM) graft will be performed.  The investigators hypothesize that the use of
      cryopreserved Human Amniotic Membrane in conjunction with a peroneal tendon repair will
      decrease that amount of inflammation, overall recovery time of surgically repaired peroneal
      tendon tears, and adhesions.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Cryopreserved Human Amniotic Membrane in the Surgical Repair of Peroneal Tendons: An Infrared Thermography Model

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Patients requiring surgical repair of the peroneal tendon

          2. Patients who voluntarily consent to research participation

          3. Patients over the age of 18

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Patients who display a high surgical risk as determined by the investigative surgeon

          2. Previous surgical repair of the peroneal tendon

          3. Patients with allergy or history of drug reactions to Ciprofloxacin or Amphotericin B

          4. Patients who are pregnant or breast feeding.

          5. Patients who have had a clinically diagnosed autoimmune disease

          6. Patients who are unwilling to restrict pre and postoperative anti-inflammatories

          7. Patients with an active infection

          8. Patients who have a medical history that would likely make the patient an unreliable
             research participant

intervention.description:
Group 1 will have standard peroneal repair surgery with the addition of the NEOX™1k tissue.
Group 2 will have standard peroneal repair surgery without the use of the NEOX™1k tissue.

clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Cryopreserved Human Amniotic Membrane in the Surgical Repair of Peroneal Tendons: An Infrared Thermography Model

primary_outcome.measure: Decrease in ankle pain, inflammation, function & activity limitation
